title: 12.3 Fashion brands - kgt34
description: Deze les valt onder de arrangeerbare leerlijn van de Stercollecties voor Engels voor vmbo kgt, leerjaar 3 en 4. Dit is thema 12 'Fashion'. Het onderwerp van deze les is: Fashion brands. In deze les staan modemerken centraal, waarbij er een modewerk besproken wordt die parfum voor baby's maakt. Ook wordt er besproken dat er verschillende smaken zijn in mode en alledaagse mode. De onregelmatige werkwoorden in deze les zijn: to see, to sell en to send. In de grammaticaopdracht worden de bijvoeglijke naamwoorden en bijwoorden behandeld.

items.content:
Het onderwerp van dit blok is modemerken.

  • Maak groepjes van drie of vier leerlingen.

Bespreek de volgende vragen in jouw groepje:

  • Welke modemerken ken je?
  • Welke modeontwerpers ken je?
  • Wat vind jij van parfum?
  • Hoe zou een parfum voor baby's kunnen ruiken?

Bekijk hieronder de stappen die je gaat zetten.

Succes.

Fashion brand makes perfume for babies

You are going to listen to a recording about perfume for babies.

  • Listen to the recording and do assignment 1.
  • Listen again to the recording and do assignment 2 and 3.

Assignment 1

Listen to the recording and answer the questions on your own, then discuss the answers in your group.

  • Which fashion brand is going to make a perfume for babies?
  • Why are they going to make a perfume for babies?

prompt.body:
What is said on the recording? Choose the right answer.

The .......................... Dolce & Gabbana
The new fragrance will be in 50-ml bottles and will .......................... $45 dollars
Designed to ....................... every little boy and girl
A mix of honey, melon, orange and ..........................
A mother's sweet hug, ........................
The new fragrance will increase ......................
Childcare experts are questioning the need for ..........................
She warned that any product used on it ......................
Smell nice but then .................. rash
Universally understood as one of the ................. the world

content.body:
Fill in the gaps.

The luxury fashion brand Dolce & Gabbana (D&G) will soon sell a .
The new fragrance will be in 50-ml bottles and will have a of $45 dollars. D&G is the latest fashion house to make a perfume for infants.
A D&G spokesperson said the is, 'designed to cuddle and pamper every little boy and girl'.
D&G boss Stefano Gabbana asked people on the website Instagram: "How can babies smell even sweeter than they already do?" His answer is a mix of , melon, orange and some secret ingredients.
Gabbana explained how he made the . He said it smells like, "The softness of baby skin, the freshness of baby breath, a mother's sweet hug, and the first smile."

While the new fragrance will D&G's profits, childcare experts are questioning the need for babies to wear perfume.
They also hope parents will use their . Baby doctor Sandy Tomkins said a baby's skin is very delicate and sensitive. She warned that any product used on it must be 100% .
She added: "The last thing a mother wants is for her little one to smell nice but then have a nasty ."
Skin doctor Jose Fernandez warned of soreness and irritation. Many people might agree with Britain's Daily Mail newspaper that babies already smell .
It wrote: "The smell of a freshly washed baby is universally understood as one of the sweetest scents in the world."

Source: http://www.breakingnewsenglish.com/1301/130128-perfume_for_babies.html

items.content:
Fashion

You are going to read two articles about fashion.

  • Read the first text, New York more fashionable than Paris and do assignment 1.
  • Read the second text, Normal Fashion and do assignment 2.
  • Read the texts again and do assignment 3.

Read the text.

Text 1

New York more fashionable than Paris

New York is officially the world's most fashionable city after taking top spot in the 2014 Top Global Fashion Capital contest. It took the title from London, which won the accolade in 2011 and 2012, but finished third this year, behind Paris.
Los Angeles was voted the fourth trendiest metropolis, while Barcelona closely followed in fifth place.
Italy's highest-placed city was Rome, in sixth place. Milan, long established as a centre of style and the winner in 2009, finished in twelfth place.
Bekka Payack, a New York-based fashion director, told reporters:
"New York City has, indeed, earned its Top Global Fashion Capital ranking through its disciplined, methodical yet creative approach to its fashion industry."


New York being crowned as the place to be seen coincides with the city's upcoming Fashion Week.
The fashion world will descend on the city for a week of glitz and glamour. Top supermodels will set the catwalks alight and parade the latest fashions from leading designers.
Ms Payack spoke of how newly-emerging cities around the world are making a name for themselves in haute couture. She said: "This year's rankings also demonstrate the creative energy that is emerging worldwide in terms of fashion as a jobs, income and wealth generator, not to mention the prestige associated with exporting your fashion sense to the world."
Cities like Shanghai, St. Petersburg and New Delhi all fared well in the contest.

Source: http://www.breakingnewsenglish.com/1402/140208-fashion.html

header.title: New York more fashionable than Paris

prompt.body:
Choose the correct answer.

Which city was the previous winner of the award?
Which city finished second in 2014?
In what position was the highest-placed Italian city?
When did Milan win the accolade?
Where does Bekka Payack work?
What or who will arrive in New York this week?
What will supermodels set alight?
What are newly-emerging cities making for themselves?
What kind of energy is New York fashion demonstrating?
What did Shanghai and New Dehli do at the contest?

items.content:
Text 2

Normal Fashion
Researchers at the Harvard Business School claim that people who do not follow "normal fashion" get more respect from others.
Doctoral student Silvia Bellezza and two of her colleagues examined how we view the social status and competence of people who do not conform to "normal" ways of dressing. They discovered that the more outlandishly people dress, the more respect they get.
Participants in the research considered others who had a "weirder" fashion to be more unique.
Researchers said that rather than think badly of someone scruffily dressed, many people believe that dressing down is a sign of confidence.
Ms Bellezza said: "If you're willing to deviate, there are upsides."

Bellezza conducted a number of experiments to test how people reacted to non-conformity. In one, people in different types of clothes shopped at expensive boutiques in Milan.
One group wore casual sports clothes, while the other donned expensive-looking outfits. The sales assistants assumed the ones in the sports gear were the bigger spenders.
In another test, students rated an unshaven, T-shirt-clad professor above an academic wearing a suit and tie.
Bellezza says high-profile entrepreneurs who dress down may be responsible for changing our perceptions.
In particular, Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg's wearing of hoodies and the late Steve Jobs' trademark jeans, sneakers and polo neck tops.

Source: http://www.breakingnewsenglish.com/1403/140326-fashion-sense.html

prompt.body:
Choose the correct answer.

Where do the researchers who conducted this survey work?
What kind of student is Silvia Bellezza?
What do more outlandishly-dressed people get?
What did people think about others with a "weirder" fashion?

content.body: they need to go back to school.

prompt.body: What is dressing down a sign of?
What did researchers test people's reactions to?
Who thought people dressed in sportswear were bigger spenders?
What did a cruffy looking professor wear?
Who might be responsible for changing our perceptions?
What did the article say Mark Zuckerberg wore?

On your own read the texts again, copy and fill in the grid. Discuss your answers in your group.

Use key words to answer the five wh-questions.

Bestudeer de woordenlijst.

Woordenlijst Fashion brands


Tip!
Er zijn verschillende manieren om woordjes te leren.
Je kunt de woorden hardop voorlezen of overschrijven.
Het belangrijkste is dat je dit niet te lang achter elkaar doet, want dan leer je niets meer.
In twee keer 10 minuten leer je meer dan in een half uur.

Irregular Verbs

Bestudeer de volgende drie irregular verbs (onregelmatige werkwoorden):

  • to see
  • to sell
  • to send

zenden, sturen


Doe de opdrachten.

content.body:
Sleep de woorden naar de juiste plaats in de tabel.

Dolce & Gabbana is a luxury fashion brand.

Dolce & Gabbana is een luxueus .

They created a new fragrance.

Ze hebben een nieuw gemaakt.

It has a price tag of 45 dollars.

Er hangt een van 45 dollar aan.

The new scent is specially created for babies.

Het nieuwe wordt speciaal voor baby's gemaakt.

New York is the fashion capital.

New York is de .

Los Angeles was voted trendiest metropolis.

Los Angeles was verkozen tot eigentijdse .

She is a New York-based fashion designer.

Zij is een in modeontwerpster.

They have a creative approach to fashion.

Ze hebben een als het om mode gaat.

The contest coincides with the Fashion Week.

De wedstrijd de Fashion Week.

The latest fashions from leading designers will be shown.

De laatste mode van zal getoond worden.

The rankings demonstrate the creative energy that is emerging worldwide.

De ranglijst laat de creatieve energie zien die .

Some people do not conform to "normal" ways of dressing.

Sommige mensen de "gewone" manier van aankleden.

People who dress more outlandishly get more respect.

Mensen die zich kleden krijgen meer respect.

Our teacher is always scruffily dressed.

Onze leraar is altijd .

They say that dressing down is a sign of confidence.

Ze zeggen dat een teken van zelfvertrouwen is.

How do people react to non-conformity?

Hoe regeren mensen op ?

I like to wear casual sports clothes.

Ik draag graag .

Would you like to see me in sports gear?

Wil je me in zien?

She likes men who wear a suit and tie.

Zij houdt van mannen die dragen.

Vertaal het Nederlandse woord in het Engels.

They created a new (parfum).
How do people react to(excentriciteit)?
The latest fashions from (toonaangevende ontwerpers)will be shown.
Our teacher is always (onverzorgd aangekleed).
I like to wear (informele sportkleding).
The contest (valt samen met) the Fashion Week.
Some people (houden zich niet aan) "normal" ways of dressing.

items.content:
Adjectives and adverbs

In dit thema herhalen we de bijvoeglijke naamwoorden en bijwoorden.
De meeste informatie die je hier krijgt heb je in vorige jaren al geleerd.

  • Lees de uitleg in de kennisbank.
  • Maak opdracht 1.
Adjectives and adverbs

header.title: Correct form of adjective or adverb

content.body:
Write down the correct form of the words in brackets (adjectives or adverbs).

Liza is (quick) . She walks .

Write down the correct form of the words in brackets (adjectives or adverbs).

Nancy is a (careless) girl. She drives her car .

Write down the correct form of the words in brackets (adjectives or adverbs).

The man is (nice) . He behaves .

Write down the correct form of the words in brackets (adjectives or adverbs).

He was (bad) injured. He had a accident.

Write down the correct form of the words in brackets (adjectives or adverbs).

They can do the maths problems (easy) . They think maths is an school subject.

Write down the correct form of the words in brackets (adjectives or adverbs).

Marie is a (good) writer. She writes .

Write down the correct form of the words in brackets (adjectives or adverbs).

Drivers must drive (slow) in this road. It is a (dangerous) road?

Write down the correct form of the words in brackets (adjectives or adverbs).

She smiled (happy) . She had a face.

Write down the correct form of the words in brackets (adjectives or adverbs).

I did the homework (complete) by myself. I'm an (autonomous) student.

items.content:
Role play

You are going to role play a discussion between people who have different opinions about fashion.

  • Read the roles. (In groups of three, skip one role).
  • Decide who is going to play which role.
  • Act out the role play.

Role A: Designer fashion
You think designer fashion is best. Tell the others why. What is wrong with the fashion the others talk about? Why?

Role B: Sportswear
You think sportswear is best. Tell the others why. What is wrong with the fashion the others talk about? Why?

Role C: Jeans and T-shirt
You think jeans and T-shirt are best. Tell the others why. What is wrong with the fashion the others talk about? Why?

Role D: Hip-hop fashion
You think hip-hop fashion is best. Tell the others why. What is wrong with the fashion the others talk about? Why?

A letter to the College of Fashion

Dit jaar doe je eindexamen en volgend jaar ga je naar het MBO. Daarna wil je graag een opleiding in Londen volgen. Je hebt op internet zitten zoeken en toen zag je dat het London College of Fashion verschillende cursussen aanbiedt op heel veel verschillende niveaus. Je vindt de informatie op de site nogal verwarrend. Daarom besluit je om een e-mail te schrijven aan de decaan van de opleiding, George Rogers.

  • Maak de schrijfopdracht eerst alleen, daarna vergelijk je jouw e-mail met die van je groepsgenoten.
  • Schrijf een e-mail met je groepje en lever deze in bij je docent.

Schrijf de e-mail aan George Rogers.

Verwerk de volgende punten:

  • Stel jezelf voor (naam, leeftijd, jongen/meisje, woonplaats, land).
  • Schrijf dat je graag een opleiding wil volgen in Londen.
  • Vermeld dat je de website van de school bekeken hebt.
  • Vertel iets over je opleiding.
  • Vraag welke cursussen je kan volgen met jouw opleiding.
  • Vraag of er een leeftijdsgrens is.
  • Informeer naar de kosten van de cursus.
  • Schrijf een passend slot.
  • Zet je naam onder de e-mail.

Vul het schema in en beantwoord de vragen onder het schema.

Activiteit leuk niet leuk makkelijk moeilijk weet ik al nieuw

The busy girl buys beauty

You are going to listen to the song The busy girl buys beauty.

  • Listen to the song.
  • Form groups of three or four pupils.
  • Discuss the song.
  • Report back to the class.
